original_title: Manjula Fernando appointed new Chairman of Public Utilities Commission
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Manjula Fernando, a professor at the University of Peradeniya, has officially taken over duties as Chairman of Sri Lanka’s Public Utilities Commission, the power regulator said in a statement.
Fernando will be succeeding the former chair, Janaka Ratnayake, who was ousted by a parliamentary vote last month.
Fernando is a senior member of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) and the founder of Sri Lanka’s Power and Energy Society chapter in 2010.
He is a Chartered Electrical Engineer since 2008 and a Fellow of the Institution of Engineers since 2014.

He received his BScEng degree from the University of Peradeniya in 1993, and he obtained his Technical Licentiate degree from the Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden, and his PhD degree from Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden, in 1997 and 1999, respectively. (Colombo/ June 22/2023)
